Title :

Object-Oriented Software Development in Java:

Patterns and Framework

This course provides fundamental design pattern usage as well as advanced OOP design concept and finally minimum implementation of framework for e-commerce Java application from simple servlet JDBC application. Detail content: to be announced. Class - 8 PM Sep 11, 2001 화요일 1> Model-View-Controller pattern - Starting with Pizza shop servlet program evolving to JDBC and Business logic separation as per MVC pattern. Discuss the importance of MVC pattern and its extension. Class - 8 PM Sep 13, 2001 Thursday 2> Data Access Object pattern - how to deal with different data storage access. how to decoupling business object from data adapt logic Class - 8 PM Sep 20, 2001 Thursday 3> Command Processor pattern - coarse grained object from fine grained objects. Class - 8 PM Sep 27, 2001 Thursday 4> Front Controller pattern - UI control logic separation from business logic. Starting Date : 8 PM Sep 6, 2001 Thursday Ending Date : 8 PM Sep 27, 2001 Thursday Schedule : one session, 2 hours per week Fee : $100 for 4 sessions Recommended Development environment : (For Job oriented environment) Visual Age for Java 3.5 Enterprise edition or Professional Edition, DB2 7.1(or 6.1) Or (For home study environment) UltraEdit MS Access Tomcat 3.2.x Text book : Not necessary. Reference Book : 1. Patterns In Java: A Catalog Of Reusable Design Patterns Illustrated With Uml by Author Mark Grand http://chapters.indigo.ca/books/details/default.asp?mscssid=GA82GFJGABDS9HBA0W522FVLEMCT2S03&WSID=11073CBC7F2B8F0144B5983C9BA4C5A7B2391606&ISBN=0471258393 2. Patterns in Java Volume 3: A Catalog of Enterprise Design Patterns Illustrated with UML by Author Mark Grand http://chapters.indigo.ca/books/details/default.asp?mscssid=GA82GFJGABDS9HBA0W522FVLEMCT2S03&WSID=11073CBC7F2B8F0144B5983C9BA4C5A7B2391606&ISBN=0471333158 3. Object-Oriented Software Development in Java: Principles, Patterns and Frameworks by Author Jia Xiaoping http://chapters.indigo.ca/books/details/default.asp?mscssid=GA82GFJGABDS9HBA0W522FVLEMCT2S03&WSID=1107E8189727746247EBACFD62A668D503601706&ISBN=020135084x http://www.depaul.edu/~xjia/ 4. J2EE design pattern - http://java.sun.com/j2ee/blueprints/design_patterns/catalog.html 5. Resource for useful servlets - http://www.npac.syr.edu/projects/tutorials/servlets/SERVLETS/ 6. Scott New Home for Design Pattern classes - http://www3.sympatico.ca/scottlee/java/pattern/ find pattern.war for PizzaServlet for tomcat and read http://www3.sympatico.ca/scottlee/java/pattern/ readme_pattern.txt for installation and test run.
